content:
Yes, many modern tattoo artists have incorporated Polynesian tattooing styles into their work, and the popularity of Polynesian tattoo styles has increased in recent years.

Some artists blend Polynesian designs with modern tattoo techniques to create unique and beautiful tattoos. Others use traditional Polynesian tools and techniques to create authentic tattoos that pay homage to the region's ancient tattooing culture.

Also, many celebrities have adopted Polynesian designs into their tattoos, including Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, Jason Momoa, and Rihanna.

In addition, there are now artists who specialize in Polynesian tattooing and travel the world to share their art with those who appreciate traditional designs.

Overall, the Polynesian tattooing style remains a meaningful and powerful form of expression, and its influence continues to inspire modern tattoo artists and enthusiasts.
